info.title: AvaTax API
info.description: REST interface to Avalara's enterprise tax service, AvaTax.

post.description:
Records a new transaction in AvaTax.

The `CreateTransaction` endpoint uses the configuration values specified by your company to identify the correct tax rules
and rates to apply to all line items in this transaction, and reports the total tax calculated by AvaTax based on your
company's configuration and the data provided in this API call.

If you don't specify type in the provided data, a new transaction with type of SalesOrder will be recorded by default.

A transaction represents a unique potentially taxable action that your company has recorded, and transactions include actions like
sales, purchases, inventory transfer, and returns (also called refunds).
You may specify one or more of the following values in the '$include' parameter to fetch additional nested data, using commas to separate multiple values:
            
* Lines
* Details (implies lines)
* Summary (implies details)
* Addresses
            
If you don't specify '$include' parameter, it will include both details and addresses.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The transaction you wish to create

parameters.name: $include
parameters.description: A comma separated list of child objects to return underneath the primary object.

parameters.name: X-Avalara-Client
parameters.description:
Identifies the software you are using to call this API to aid in debugging and verification.
                    This is a string in the format `(app name); (app version); (library name); (library version); (machine name)`. 
                    For more information about designing an Avalara client string for your application, please see the developer website.

get.description:
Resolve an address against Avalara's address-validation system.  If the address can be resolved, this API 
provides the latitude and longitude of the resolved location.  The value 'resolutionQuality' can be used 
to identify how closely this address can be located.  If the address cannot be clearly located, use the 
'messages' structure to learn more about problems with this address.
This is the same API as the POST /api/v2/addresses/resolve endpoint.
Both verbs are supported to provide for flexible implementation.

id.description: The unique ID number assigned to this account.

securityRoleId.description: The security level for this user.

passwordStatus.description: The status of the user's password.

isActive.description: True if this user is currently active.

code.description: Name of the error or message.

x-enum-value-comments.ServerConfiguration: Server has a configuration or setup problem
x-enum-value-comments.AccountInvalidException: User doesn't have rights to this account or company
x-enum-value-comments.EntityNotFoundError: Use this error message when the user is trying to fetch a single object and the object either does not exist or cannot be seen by the current user.
x-enum-value-comments.GetTaxError: Errors in Soap V1 Passthrough / GetTax calls
x-enum-value-comments.BadDocumentFetch: Represents a malformed document fetch command
x-enum-value-comments.ServerUnreachable: Represents a SQL server timeout error / deadlock error
x-enum-value-comments.CannotModifyLockedTransaction: Create or update transaction error codes

number.description: Unique ID number referring to this error or message.

message.description: Concise summary of the message, suitable for display in the caption of an alert box.
message.example: The entity was marked as deleted.

description.description: A more detailed description of the problem referenced by this error message, suitable for display in the contents area of an alert box.

faultCode.description: Indicates the SOAP Fault code, if this was related to an error that corresponded to AvaTax SOAP v1 behavior.

helpLink.description: URL to help for this message

refersTo.description: Item the message refers to, if applicable.  This is used to indicate a missing or incorrect value.

example.message: The entity was marked as deleted.

NewAccountRequestModel.description:
Represents a request for a new account with Avalara for a new subscriber.
Contains information about the account requested and the rate plan selected.

products.description: The list of products to which this account would like to subscribe.

connectorName.description:
The name of the connector that will be the primary method of access used to call the account created.
For a list of available connectors, please contact your Avalara representative.

parentAccountNumber.description:
An approved partner account can be referenced when provisioning an account, allowing a link between 
the partner and the provisioned account.

referrerId.description: Identifies a referring partner for the assessment of referral-based commissions.

paymentMethodId.description: Zuora-generated Payment ID to which the new account should be associated. For free trial accounts, an empty string is acceptable.

effectiveDate.description: The date on which the account should take effect.  If null, defaults to today.

endDate.description: The date on which the account should expire.  If null, defaults to a 90-day trial account.

firstName.description: First Name of the primary contact person for this account

lastName.description: Last Name of the primary contact person for this account

title.description: Title of the primary contact person for this account

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of the primary contact person for this account

email.description: Email of the primary contact person for this account

userPassword.description:
If no password is supplied, an a tempoarary password is generated by the system and emailed to the user. The user will 
be challenged to change this password upon logging in to the Admin Console. If supplied, will be the set password for 
the default created user, and the user will not be challenged to change their password upon login to the Admin Console.

NewAccountModel.description: Represents information about a newly created account

accountId.description: This is the ID number of the account that was created

accountDetailsEmailedTo.description: This is the email address to which credentials were mailed

createdDate.description: The date and time when this account was created

emailedDate.description: The date and time when account information was emailed to the user

limitations.description: If this account includes any limitations, specify them here

FreeTrialRequestModel.description:
Represents a request for a free trial account for AvaTax.
Free trial accounts are only available on the Sandbox environment.

firstName.description: The first or given name of the user requesting a free trial.

lastName.description: The last or family name of the user requesting a free trial.

email.description: The email address of the user requesting a free trial.

company.description:
The company or organizational name for this free trial.  If this account is for personal use, it is acceptable 
to use your full name here.

phone.description: The phone number of the person requesting the free trial.

ResetLicenseKeyModel.description: Represents a license key reset request.

accountId.description: The primary key of the account ID to reset

confirmResetLicenseKey.description:
Set this value to true to reset the license key for this account.
This license key reset function will only work when called using the credentials of the account administrator of this account.

LicenseKeyModel.description: Represents a license key for this account.

accountId.description: The primary key of the account

privateLicenseKey.description:
This is your private license key.  You must record this license key for safekeeping.
If you lose this key, you must contact the ResetLicenseKey API in order to request a new one.
Each account can only have one license key at a time.

httpRequestHeader.description:
If your software allows you to specify the HTTP Authorization header directly, this is the header string you 
should use when contacting Avalara to make API calls with this license key.

ActivateAccountModel.description: Represents a request to activate an account by reading and accepting its terms and conditions.

acceptAvalaraTermsAndConditions.description: Set this to true if and only if you accept Avalara's terms and conditions for your account.

haveReadAvalaraTermsAndConditions.description: Set this to true if and only if you have fully read Avalara's terms and conditions for your account.

AccountConfigurationModel.description: Represents one configuration setting for this account

accountId.description: The unique ID number of the account to which this setting applies

category.description: The category of the configuration setting.  Avalara-defined categories include `AddressServiceConfig` and `TaxServiceConfig`.  Customer-defined categories begin with `X-`.

name.description: The name of the configuration setting

value.description: The current value of the configuration setting

createdDate.description: The date when this record was created.

createdUserId.description: The User ID of the user who created this record.

modifiedDate.description: The date/time when this record was last modified.

modifiedUserId.description: The user ID of the user who last modified this record.

textCase.description: Specify the text case for the validated address result.  If not specified, will return uppercase.
textCase.x-enum-description: Casing to use for validation result

region.description: State / Province / Region

country.description: Two character ISO 3166 Country Code

coordinates.description: The geospatial coordinates of this address

resolutionQuality.description: The resolution quality of the geospatial coordinates
resolutionQuality.x-enum-description: The address resolution quality of an address validation result

x-enum-value-comments.External: Location was already geocoded on the request
x-enum-value-comments.PartialCentroid: Geocoded at a level more coarse than a PostalCentroid1
x-enum-value-comments.PostalCentroidGood: Largest postal code (zip5 in US, left three in CA, etc
x-enum-value-comments.PostalCentroidBest: Best postal code (zip9 in US, complete postal code elsewhere)
x-enum-value-comments.Rooftop: Assumed to be rooftop level, non-interpolated
x-enum-value-comments.Constant: Pulled from a static list of geocodes for specific jurisdictions

taxAuthorities.description: List of informational and warning messages regarding this address

messages.description: List of informational and warning messages regarding this address

example.details: The physical location exists but there are no homes on this street. One reason might be railroad tracks or rivers running alongside this street, as they would prevent construction of homes in this location.

messages.details: The physical location exists but there are no homes on this street. One reason might be railroad tracks or rivers running alongside this street, as they would prevent construction of homes in this location.

region.description: State / Province / Region

country.description: Two character ISO 3166 Country Code

addressType.description:
Address type code. One of: 
* F - Firm or company address
* G - General Delivery address
* H - High-rise or business complex
* P - PO Box address
* R - Rural route address
* S - Street or residential address

region.description: State / Province / Region

country.description: Two character ISO 3166 Country Code

AvaTaxMessage.description: Informational or warning messages returned by AvaTax with a transaction

summary.description: A brief summary of what this message tells us

details.description: Detailed information that explains what the summary provided

refersTo.description: Information about what object in your request this message refers to

severity.description: A category that indicates how severely this message affects the results

source.description: The name of the code or service that generated this message

BatchModel.description: Represents a batch of uploaded documents.

id.description: The unique ID number of this batch.

name.description: The user-friendly readable name for this batch.

accountId.description: The Account ID number of the account that owns this batch.

companyId.description: The Company ID number of the company that owns this batch.

type.x-enum-description: The type of data contained in this batch

x-enum-value-comments.TransactionImport:
This batch type represents tax transaction data being uploaded to AvaTax.  Each line in the batch represents a single transaction
            or a line in a multi-line transaction.  For reference, see [Batched Transactions in REST v2](http://developer.avalara.com/blog/2016/10/24/batch-transaction-upload-in-rest-v2)

status.x-enum-description: The status of a batch file

x-enum-value-comments.Waiting: Batch file has been received and is in the queue to be processed.
x-enum-value-comments.SystemErrors: Batch file experienced system errors and cannot be processed.
x-enum-value-comments.Completed: Batch file has been completely processed.
x-enum-value-comments.Creating: Batch file is currently being created.
x-enum-value-comments.Errors: Batch file was processed with some errors.

options.description: Any optional flags provided for this batch

batchAgent.description: The agent used to create this batch

startedDate.description: The date/time when this batch started processing

recordCount.description: The number of records in this batch; determined by the server

completedDate.description: The date/time when this batch was completely processed

createdDate.description: The date when this record was created.

createdUserId.description: The User ID of the user who created this record.

modifiedDate.description: The date/time when this record was last modified.

modifiedUserId.description: The user ID of the user who last modified this record.

files.description: The list of files contained in this batch.

BatchFileModel.description: Represents one file in a batch upload.

id.description: The unique ID number assigned to this batch file.

batchId.description: The unique ID number of the batch that this file belongs to.

contentType.description: Content mime type (e.g. text/csv).  This is used for HTTP downloading.

errorCount.description: Number of errors that occurred when processing this file.

id.description: The unique ID number of this company.

accountId.description: The unique ID number of the account this company belongs to.

parentCompanyId.description: If this company is fully owned by another company, this is the unique identity of the parent company.

sstPid.description: If this company files Streamlined Sales Tax, this is the PID of this company as defined by the Streamlined Sales Tax governing board.

companyCode.description: A unique code that references this company within your account.

name.description: The name of this company, as shown to customers.

isDefault.description: This flag is true if this company is the default company for this account.  Only one company may be set as the default.

defaultLocationId.description: If set, this is the unique ID number of the default location for this company.

isActive.description: This flag indicates whether tax activity can occur for this company.  Set this flag to true to permit the company to process transactions.

taxpayerIdNumber.description:
For United States companies, this field contains your Taxpayer Identification Number.  
This is a nine digit number that is usually called an EIN for an Employer Identification Number if this company is a corporation, 
or SSN for a Social Security Number if this company is a person.
This value is required if you subscribe to Avalara Managed Returns or the SST Certified Service Provider services, 
but it is optional if you do not subscribe to either of those services.

hasProfile.description:
Set this flag to true to give this company its own unique tax profile.
If this flag is true, this company will have its own Nexus, TaxRule, TaxCode, and Item definitions.
If this flag is false, this company will inherit all profile values from its parent.

isReportingEntity.description:
Set this flag to true if this company must file its own tax returns.
For users who have Returns enabled, this flag turns on monthly Worksheet generation for the company.

sstEffectiveDate.description: If this company participates in Streamlined Sales Tax, this is the date when the company joined the SST program.

defaultCountry.description: The two character ISO-3166 country code of the default country for this company.

baseCurrencyCode.description: This is the three character ISO-4217 currency code of the default currency used by this company.

roundingLevelId.description: Indicates whether this company prefers to round amounts at the document level or line level.
roundingLevelId.x-enum-description: Choice of rounding level for a transaction

x-enum-value-comments.Line: Round tax on each line separately
x-enum-value-comments.Document: Round tax at the document level

warningsEnabled.description: Set this value to true to receive warnings in API calls via SOAP.

isTest.description:
Set this flag to true to indicate that this company is a test company.
If you have Returns enabled, Test companies will not file tax returns and can be used for validation purposes.

taxDependencyLevelId.description: Used to apply tax detail dependency at a jurisdiction level.

inProgress.description:
Set this value to true to indicate that you are still working to finish configuring this company.
While this value is true, no tax reporting will occur and the company will not be usable for transactions.

createdDate.description: The date when this record was created.

createdUserId.description: The User ID of the user who created this record.

modifiedDate.description: The date/time when this record was last modified.

modifiedUserId.description: The user ID of the user who last modified this record.

contacts.description: Optional: A list of contacts defined for this company.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=Contacts" to your URL.

items.description: Optional: A list of items defined for this company.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=Items" to your URL.

locations.description: Optional: A list of locations defined for this company.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=Locations" to your URL.

nexus.description: Optional: A list of nexus defined for this company.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=Nexus" to your URL.

settings.description: Optional: A list of settings defined for this company.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=Settings" to your URL.

taxCodes.description: Optional: A list of tax codes defined for this company.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=TaxCodes" to your URL.

taxRules.description: Optional: A list of tax rules defined for this company.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=TaxRules" to your URL.

upcs.description: Optional: A list of UPCs defined for this company.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=UPCs" to your URL.

contactCode.description: A unique code for this contact.

firstName.description: The first or given name of this contact.

middleName.description: The middle name of this contact.

lastName.description: The last or family name of this contact.

line1.description: The first line of the postal mailing address of this contact.

line2.description: The second line of the postal mailing address of this contact.

postalCode.description: The postal code or zip code of the postal mailing address of this contact.

email.description: The email address of this contact.

phone.description: The main phone number for this contact.

mobile.description: The mobile phone number for this contact.

fax.description: The facsimile phone number for this contact.

createdDate.description: The date when this record was created.

createdUserId.description: The User ID of the user who created this record.

modifiedDate.description: The date/time when this record was last modified.

ItemModel.description: Represents an item in your company's product catalog.

id.description: The unique ID number of this item.

companyId.description: The unique ID number of the company that owns this item.

itemCode.description: A unique code representing this item.

taxCodeId.description:
The unique ID number of the tax code that is applied when selling this item.
When creating or updating an item, you can either specify the Tax Code ID number or the Tax Code string; you do not need to specify both values.

taxCode.description:
The unique code string of the Tax Code that is applied when selling this item.
When creating or updating an item, you can either specify the Tax Code ID number or the Tax Code string; you do not need to specify both values.

description.description: A friendly description of this item in your product catalog.

createdDate.description: The date when this record was created.

createdUserId.description: The User ID of the user who created this record.

modifiedDate.description: The date/time when this record was last modified.

modifiedUserId.description: The user ID of the user who last modified this record.

LocationModel.description:
A location where this company does business.
Some jurisdictions may require you to list all locations where your company does business.

id.description: The unique ID number of this location.

companyId.description: The unique ID number of the company that operates at this location.

locationCode.description: A code that identifies this location.  Must be unique within your company.

description.description: A friendly name for this location.

addressTypeId.description: Indicates whether this location is a physical place of business or a temporary salesperson location.
addressTypeId.x-enum-description: Indicates whether this address refers to a person or an business

x-enum-value-comments.Location: A business location, for example a store, warehouse, or office.
x-enum-value-comments.Salesperson: A person's address who performs sales tasks for the company remotely from an office.

addressCategoryId.description: Indicates the type of place of business represented by this location.
addressCategoryId.x-enum-description: The type of address represented by this object

x-enum-value-comments.Storefront: Address refers to a storefront location
x-enum-value-comments.MainOffice: Address refers to a main office of this company
x-enum-value-comments.Warehouse: Address refers to a warehouse or other non-public location
x-enum-value-comments.Salesperson: Address refers to a location for a single salesperson
x-enum-value-comments.Other: Address is a type not reflected in the other lists

line1.description: The first line of the physical address of this location.

line2.description: The second line of the physical address of this location.

line3.description: The third line of the physical address of this location.

city.description: The city of the physical address of this location.

county.description: The county name of the physical address of this location.  Not required.

region.description: The state, region, or province of the physical address of this location.

postalCode.description: The postal code or zip code of the physical address of this location.

country.description: The two character ISO-3166 country code of the physical address of this location.

isDefault.description: Set this flag to true to indicate that this is the default location for this company.

isRegistered.description: Set this flag to true to indicate that this location has been registered with a tax authority.

dbaName.description: If this location has a different business name from its legal entity name, specify the "Doing Business As" name for this location.

outletName.description: A friendly name for this location.

effectiveDate.description: The date when this location was opened for business, or null if not known.

endDate.description: If this place of business has closed, the date when this location closed business.

lastTransactionDate.description: The most recent date when a transaction was processed for this location.  Set by AvaTax.

registeredDate.description: The date when this location was registered with a tax authority.  Not required.

createdDate.description: The date when this record was created.

createdUserId.description: The User ID of the user who created this record.

modifiedDate.description: The date/time when this record was last modified.

modifiedUserId.description: The user ID of the user who last modified this record.

settings.description:
Extra information required by certain jurisdictions for filing.
For a list of settings recognized by Avalara, query the endpoint "/api/v2/definitions/locationquestions". 
To determine the list of settings required for this location, query the endpoint "/api/v2/companies/(id)/locations/(id)/validate".

NexusModel.description: Represents a declaration of nexus within a particular taxing jurisdiction.

id.description: The unique ID number of this declaration of nexus.

companyId.description: The unique ID number of the company that declared nexus.

country.description: The two character ISO-3166 country code of the country in which this company declared nexus.

region.description: The two or three character ISO region code of the region, state, or province in which this company declared nexus.

jurisTypeId.description: The jurisdiction type of the jurisdiction in which this company declared nexus.
jurisTypeId.x-enum-description: Types of jurisdiction referenced in a transaction

jurisCode.description: The code identifying the jurisdiction in which this company declared nexus.

jurisName.description: The common name of the jurisdiction in which this company declared nexus.

effectiveDate.description: The date when this nexus began.  If not known, set to null.

endDate.description: If this nexus will end or has ended on a specific date, set this to the date when this nexus ends.

shortName.description: The short name of the jurisdiction.

signatureCode.description: The signature code of the boundary region as defined by Avalara.

stateAssignedNo.description: The state assigned number of this jurisdiction.

nexusTypeId.description:
(DEPRECATED) The type of nexus that this company is declaring.
Please use NexusTaxTypeGroupId instead.
nexusTypeId.x-enum-description: Describes the different types of statuses which describe an entity (company).

x-enum-value-comments.SalesOrSellersUseTax:
Indicates the entity is voluntarily collecting tax (default)
            
            This has replaced Collect
x-enum-value-comments.SalesTax:
Indicates the entity is required to collect tax in the state
            
            This has replaced Legal
x-enum-value-comments.SSTVolunteer:
Indicates the entity is registered as a Volunteer in an SST state.
            Only your SST administrator may set this option.
x-enum-value-comments.SSTNonVolunteer:
Indicates the entity is registered as a Non-Volunteer in an SST state.
            Only your SST administrator may set this option.

sourcing.description: Indicates whether this nexus is defined as origin or destination nexus.

x-enum-value-comments.Mixed: Mixed sourcing, for states that do both origin and destination calculation

hasLocalNexus.description:
True if you are also declaring local nexus within this jurisdiction.
Many U.S. states have options for declaring nexus in local jurisdictions as well as within the state.

localNexusTypeId.description:
If you are declaring local nexus within this jurisdiction, this indicates whether you are declaring only 
a specified list of local jurisdictions, all state-administered local jurisdictions, or all local jurisdictions.

hasPermanentEstablishment.description: Set this value to true if your company has a permanent establishment within this jurisdiction.

taxId.description: Optional - the tax identification number under which you declared nexus.

streamlinedSalesTax.description:
For the United States, this flag indicates whether this particular nexus falls within a U.S. State that participates 
in the Streamlined Sales Tax program.  For countries other than the US, this flag is null.

createdDate.description: The date when this record was created.

createdUserId.description: The User ID of the user who created this record.

modifiedDate.description: The date/time when this record was last modified.

modifiedUserId.description: The user ID of the user who last modified this record.

nexusTaxTypeGroup.description:
The type of nexus that this company is declaring.Replaces NexusTypeId.
Use /api/v2/definitions/nexustaxtypegroup for a list of tax type groups.

SettingModel.description:
This object is used to keep track of custom information about a company.
A setting can refer to any type of data you need to remember about this company object.
When creating this object, you may define your own "set", "name", and "value" parameters.
To define your own values, please choose a "set" name that begins with "X-" to indicate an extension.

id.description: The unique ID number of this setting.

companyId.description: The unique ID number of the company this setting refers to.

set.description: A user-defined "set" containing this name-value pair.

name.description: A user-defined "name" for this name-value pair.

value.description: The value of this name-value pair.

TaxCodeModel.description:
Represents a tax code that can be applied to items on a transaction.
A tax code can have specific rules for specific jurisdictions that change the tax calculation behavior.

id.description: The unique ID number of this tax code.

TaxRuleModel.description: Represents a tax rule that changes the behavior of Avalara's tax engine for certain products in certain jurisdictions.

companyId.description: The unique ID number of the company that owns this tax rule.

The unique ID number of the tax code for this rule.
When creating or updating a tax rule, you may specify either the taxCodeId value or the taxCode value.

taxCode.description:
The code string of the tax code for this rule.
When creating or updating a tax rule, you may specify either the taxCodeId value or the taxCode value.

stateFIPS.description: For U.S. tax rules, this is the state's Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code.

taxTypeId.x-enum-description:
This data type is only used when an object must "Match" tax types.  By specifying options here,
            you can indicate which tax types will match for the purposes of this object.
            For example, if you specify BothSalesAndUseTax, this value matches with both sales and seller's use tax.

x-enum-value-comments.BothSalesAndUseTax: Match both Sales and Use Tax only
x-enum-value-comments.VATNonrecoverableInputTax: Match VAT Nonrecoverable Input Tax only
x-enum-value-comments.ConsumerUseAndSalesTax: Match both Consumer Use and Sales Tax types
x-enum-value-comments.ConsumersUseAndSellersUseTax: Match both Consumer Use and Seller's Use Tax types

rateTypeId.description: (DEPRECATED) Enumerated rate type to which this rule applies.  Please use rateTypeCode instead.

rateTypeCode.description: Indicates the code of the rate type that applies to this rule.  Use `/api/v2/definitions/ratetypes` for a full list of rate type codes.

taxRuleTypeId.description:
This type value determines the behavior of the tax rule.
You can specify that this rule controls the product's taxability or exempt / nontaxable status, the product's rate 
(for example, if you have been granted an official ruling for your product's rate that differs from the official rate), 
or other types of behavior.

isAllJuris.description: Set this value to true if this tax rule applies in all jurisdictions.

value.description: The corrected rate for this tax rule.

cap.description: The maximum cap for the price of this item according to this rule.

threshold.description: The per-unit threshold that must be met before this rule applies.

options.description: Custom option flags for this rule.

effectiveDate.description: The first date at which this rule applies.  If null, this rule will apply to all dates prior to the end date.

endDate.description: The last date for which this rule applies.  If null, this rule will apply to all dates after the effective date.

description.description: A friendly name for this tax rule.

countyFIPS.description: For U.S. tax rules, this is the county's Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code.

isSTPro.description: If true, indicates this rule is for Sales Tax Pro.

country.description: The two character ISO 3166 country code for the locations where this rule applies.

region.description: The state, region, or province name for the locations where this rule applies.

sourcing.description: The sourcing types to which this rule applies.

x-enum-value-comments.Mixed: Mixed sourcing, for states that do both origin and destination calculation

JurisdictionOverrideModel.description:
Represents an override of tax jurisdictions for a specific address.

During the time period represented by EffDate through EndDate, all tax decisions for addresses matching
this override object will be assigned to the list of jurisdictions designated in this object.

The two character ISO-3166 country code of the country affected by this override.
Note that only United States addresses are affected by the jurisdiction override system.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the physical location affected by this override.

effectiveDate.description: The date when this override first takes effect.  Set this value to null to affect all dates up to the end date.

endDate.description: The date when this override will cease to take effect.  Set this value to null to never expire.

FilingCalendarModel.description:
Represents a commitment to file a tax return on a recurring basis.
Only used if you subscribe to Avalara Returns.

id.description: The unique ID number of this filing calendar.

companyId.description: The unique ID number of the company to which this filing calendar belongs.

returnName.description: The name of the tax form to file.

locationCode.description: If this calendar is for a location-specific tax return, specify the location code here.  To file for all locations, leave this value NULL.

outletTypeId.description: If this calendar is for a location-specific tax return, specify the location-specific behavior here.
outletTypeId.x-enum-description:
Indicates the behavior of a tax form for a company with multiple places of business.
            
            Some tax authorities require that a separate form must be filed for each place of business.

x-enum-value-comments.None: File a single return per cycle for your entire business.
x-enum-value-comments.Schedule: You may file separate forms for each outlet; contact the tax authority for more details about location based reporting requirements.
x-enum-value-comments.Duplicate: You may file separate forms for each outlet; contact the tax authority for more details about location based reporting requirements.
x-enum-value-comments.Consolidated: File a single return, but you must have a line item for each place of business.

paymentCurrency.description: Specify the ISO 4217 currency code for the currency to remit for this tax return.  For all tax returns in the United States, specify "USD".

filingFrequencyId.description: The frequency on which this tax form is filed.

x-enum-value-comments.Occasional: File only when there are documents to report
x-enum-value-comments.InverseQuarterly: File for the first two months of each quarter, then do not file on the quarterly month.

months.description: A 16-bit bitmap containing a 1 for each month when the return should be filed.

stateRegistrationId.description: Tax Registration ID for this Region - in the U.S., this is for your state.

localRegistrationId.description: Tax Registration ID for the local jurisdiction, if any.

employerIdentificationNumber.description: The Employer Identification Number or Taxpayer Identification Number that is to be used when filing this return.

line1.description: The first line of the physical address to be used when filing this tax return.

line2.description:
The second line of the physical address to be used when filing this tax return.
Please note that some tax forms do not support multiple address lines.

city.description: The city name of the physical address to be used when filing this tax return.

region.description: The state, region, or province of the physical address to be used when filing this tax return.

postalCode.description: The postal code or zip code of the physical address to be used when filing this tax return.

country.description: The two character ISO-3166 country code of the physical address to be used when filing this return.

phone.description: The phone number to be used when filing this return.

customerFilingInstructions.description:
Special filing instructions to be used when filing this return.
Please note that requesting special filing instructions may incur additional costs.

legalEntityName.description: The legal entity name to be used when filing this return.

effectiveDate.description:
The earliest date for the tax period when this return should be filed.
This date specifies the earliest date for tax transactions that should be reported on this filing calendar.
Please note that tax is usually filed one month in arrears: for example, tax for January transactions is typically filed during the month of February.

endDate.description:
The last date for the tax period when this return should be filed.
This date specifies the last date for tax transactions that should be reported on this filing calendar.
Please note that tax is usually filed one month in arrears: for example, tax for January transactions is typically filed during the month of February.

filingTypeId.description: The method to be used when filing this return.
filingTypeId.x-enum-description: A list of possible AvaFile filing types.

x-enum-value-comments.PaperReturn: Denotes the tax return is being filed on paper.
x-enum-value-comments.ElectronicReturn: Denotes the tax return is being filed via electronic means; excludes SST electronic filing.
x-enum-value-comments.SER: Denotes the tax return is an SST filing.
x-enum-value-comments.EFTPaper: Denotes a return is paid via EFT and filed on paper without payment.
x-enum-value-comments.PhonePaper: Denotes a return is paid via phone and filed on paper without payment.
x-enum-value-comments.SignatureReady: Denotes a return is prepared but delivered to the customer for filing and payment.
x-enum-value-comments.EfileCheck: Denotes a return which is filed online but paid by check.

eFileUsername.description: If you file electronically, this is the username you use to log in to the tax authority's website.

eFilePassword.description: If you file electronically, this is the password or pass code you use to log in to the tax authority's website.

prepayPercentage.description:
If you are required to prepay a percentage of taxes for future periods, please specify the percentage in whole numbers; 
for example, the value 90 would indicate 90%.

taxTypeId.description: The type of tax to report on this return.
taxTypeId.x-enum-description:
This data type is only used when an object must "Match" tax types.  By specifying options here,
            you can indicate which tax types will match for the purposes of this object.
            For example, if you specify BothSalesAndUseTax, this value matches with both sales and seller's use tax.

x-enum-value-comments.BothSalesAndUseTax: Match both Sales and Use Tax only
x-enum-value-comments.VATNonrecoverableInputTax: Match VAT Nonrecoverable Input Tax only
x-enum-value-comments.ConsumerUseAndSalesTax: Match both Consumer Use and Sales Tax types
x-enum-value-comments.ConsumersUseAndSellersUseTax: Match both Consumer Use and Seller's Use Tax types

taxTypeId.x-enum-description:
This data type is only used when an object must "Match" tax types.  By specifying options here,
            you can indicate which tax types will match for the purposes of this object.
            For example, if you specify BothSalesAndUseTax, this value matches with both sales and seller's use tax.

x-enum-value-comments.BothSalesAndUseTax: Match both Sales and Use Tax only
x-enum-value-comments.VATNonrecoverableInputTax: Match VAT Nonrecoverable Input Tax only
x-enum-value-comments.ConsumerUseAndSalesTax: Match both Consumer Use and Sales Tax types
x-enum-value-comments.ConsumersUseAndSellersUseTax: Match both Consumer Use and Seller's Use Tax types

month.description:
The month of the filing period for this tax filing.  
The filing period represents the year and month of the last day of taxes being reported on this filing.  
For example, an annual tax filing for Jan-Dec 2015 would have a filing period of Dec 2015.

year.description:
The year of the filing period for this tax filing.
The filing period represents the year and month of the last day of taxes being reported on this filing.  
For example, an annual tax filing for Jan-Dec 2015 would have a filing period of Dec 2015.

TransactionModel.description: A single transaction - for example, a sales invoice or purchase order.

id.description: The unique ID number of this transaction.

code.description: A unique customer-provided code identifying this transaction.

companyId.description: The unique ID number of the company that recorded this transaction.

date.description: The date on which this transaction occurred.

paymentDate.description: The date when payment was made on this transaction.  By default, this should be the same as the date of the transaction.

x-enum-value-comments.Saved: Saved document (SalesInvoice or PurchaseInvoice) ready to be posted
x-enum-value-comments.Committed: A posted document that has been committed
x-enum-value-comments.Cancelled: A Committed document that has been cancelled
x-enum-value-comments.Adjusted: A document that has been adjusted
x-enum-value-comments.Queued: A document which is in Queue status and processed later
x-enum-value-comments.PendingApproval: A document which is Pending for Approval

type.description:
The type of the transaction.  For Returns customers, a transaction type of "Invoice" will be reported to the tax authorities.
A sales transaction represents a sale from the company to a customer.  A purchase transaction represents a purchase made by the company.
A return transaction represents a customer who decided to request a refund after purchasing a product from the company.  An inventory 
transfer transaction represents goods that were moved from one location of the company to another location without changing ownership.

x-enum-value-comments.SalesOrder: Sales Order, estimate or quote (default).  This is a temporary document type and is not saved in tax history.
x-enum-value-comments.PurchaseOrder: Purchase order, estimate, or quote.  This is a temporary document type and is not saved in tax history.
x-enum-value-comments.ReturnOrder: Sales Return Order.  This is a temporary document type and is not saved in tax history.

batchCode.description: If this transaction was created as part of a batch, this code indicates which batch.

currencyCode.description: The three-character ISO 4217 currency code that was used for payment for this transaction.

customerUsageType.description: The customer usage type for this transaction.  Customer usage types often affect exemption or taxability rules.

exemptNo.description: If this transaction was exempt, this field will contain the word "Exempt".

reconciled.description: If this transaction has been reconciled against the company's ledger, this value is set to true.

locationCode.description:
If this transaction was made from a specific reporting location, this is the code string of the location.
For customers using Returns, this indicates how tax will be reported according to different locations on the tax forms.

purchaseOrderNo.description: The customer-supplied purchase order number of this transaction.

referenceCode.description: A user-defined reference code for this transaction.

salespersonCode.description: The salesperson who provided this transaction.  Not required.

taxOverrideType.description: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates what type of tax override was applied.

x-enum-value-comments.TaxAmount: Tax was overriden by the client
x-enum-value-comments.Exemption: Entity exemption was ignored (e.g. item was consumed)
x-enum-value-comments.TaxDate: Only the tax date was overriden
x-enum-value-comments.DeriveTaxable: Derive the taxable amount from the tax amount

taxOverrideAmount.description: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the amount of tax that was requested by the customer.

taxOverrideReason.description: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the reason for the tax override.

totalAmount.description: The total amount of this transaction.

totalExempt.description: The amount of this transaction that was exempt.

totalTax.description: The total tax calculated for all lines in this transaction.

totalTaxable.description: The portion of the total amount of this transaction that was taxable.

totalTaxCalculated.description: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the amount of tax Avalara calculated for the transaction.

adjustmentReason.description: If this transaction was adjusted, indicates the unique ID number of the reason why the transaction was adjusted.
adjustmentReason.x-enum-description: Indicates the type of adjustment that was performed on a transaction

x-enum-value-comments.NotAdjusted: The transaction has not been adjusted
x-enum-value-comments.SourcingIssue: A sourcing issue existed which caused the transaction to be adjusted
x-enum-value-comments.ReconciledWithGeneralLedger: Transaction was adjusted to reconcile it with a general ledger
x-enum-value-comments.ExemptCertApplied: Transaction was adjusted after an exemption certificate was applied
x-enum-value-comments.PriceAdjusted: Transaction was adjusted when the price of an item changed
x-enum-value-comments.ProductReturned: Transaction was adjusted due to a product return
x-enum-value-comments.ProductExchanged: Transaction was adjusted due to a product exchange
x-enum-value-comments.BadDebt: Transaction was adjusted due to bad or uncollectable debt
x-enum-value-comments.Other: Transaction was adjusted for another reason not specified

adjustmentDescription.description: If this transaction was adjusted, indicates a description of the reason why the transaction was adjusted.

locked.description: If this transaction has been reported to a tax authority, this transaction is considered locked and may not be adjusted after reporting.

region.description: The two-or-three character ISO region code of the region for this transaction.

country.description: The two-character ISO 3166 code of the country for this transaction.

version.description:
If this transaction was adjusted, this indicates the version number of this transaction.  Incremented each time the transaction
is adjusted.

softwareVersion.description: The software version used to calculate this transaction.

originAddressId.description: The unique ID number of the origin address for this transaction.

destinationAddressId.description: The unique ID number of the destination address for this transaction.

exchangeRateEffectiveDate.description: If this transaction included foreign currency exchange, this is the date as of which the exchange rate was calculated.

exchangeRate.description: If this transaction included foreign currency exchange, this is the exchange rate that was used.

isSellerImporterOfRecord.description: If true, this seller was considered the importer of record of a product shipped internationally.

description.description: Description of this transaction.

email.description: Email address associated with this transaction.

businessIdentificationNo.description: VAT business identification number used for this transaction.

modifiedDate.description: The date/time when this record was last modified.

modifiedUserId.description: The user ID of the user who last modified this record.

lines.description: Optional: A list of line items in this transaction.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=Lines" or "?$include=Details" to your URL.

addresses.description: Optional: A list of line items in this transaction.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=Addresses" to your URL.

locationTypes.description: Optional: A list of location types in this transaction.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=Addresses" to your URL.

summary.description: Contains a summary of tax on this transaction.

parameters.description: Contains a list of extra parameters that were set when the transaction was created.

messages.description: List of informational and warning messages regarding this API call.  These messages are only relevant to the current API call.

TransactionLineModel.description: One line item on this transaction.

id.description: The unique ID number of this transaction line item.

transactionId.description: The unique ID number of the transaction to which this line item belongs.

lineNumber.description: The line number or code indicating the line on this invoice or receipt or document.

boundaryOverrideId.description: The unique ID number of the boundary override applied to this line item.

customerUsageType.description: The customer usage type for this line item.  Usage type often affects taxability rules.

description.description: A description of the item or service represented by this line.

destinationAddressId.description:
The unique ID number of the destination address where this line was delivered or sold.
In the case of a point-of-sale transaction, the destination address and origin address will be the same.
In the case of a shipped transaction, they will be different.

originAddressId.description:
The unique ID number of the origin address where this line was delivered or sold.
In the case of a point-of-sale transaction, the origin address and destination address will be the same.
In the case of a shipped transaction, they will be different.

discountAmount.description:
The amount of discount that was applied to this line item.  This represents the difference between list price and sale price of the item.
In general, a discount represents money that did not change hands; tax is calculated on only the amount of money that changed hands.

discountTypeId.description: The type of discount, if any, that was applied to this line item.

exemptAmount.description: The amount of this line item that was exempt.

exemptCertId.description: The unique ID number of the exemption certificate that applied to this line item.

exemptNo.description: If this line item was exempt, this string contains the word 'Exempt'.

isItemTaxable.description: True if this item is taxable.

isSSTP.description: True if this item is a Streamlined Sales Tax line item.

itemCode.description: The code string of the item represented by this line item.

lineAmount.description:
The total amount of the transaction, including both taxable and exempt.  This is the total price for all items.
To determine the individual item price, divide this by quantity.

quantity.description: The quantity of products sold on this line item.

ref1.description: A user-defined reference identifier for this transaction line item.

ref2.description: A user-defined reference identifier for this transaction line item.

reportingDate.description:
The date when this transaction should be reported.  By default, all transactions are reported on the date when the actual transaction took place.
In some cases, line items may be reported later due to delayed shipments or other business reasons.

revAccount.description: The revenue account number for this line item.

sourcing.description: Indicates whether this line item was taxed according to the origin or destination.

x-enum-value-comments.Mixed: Mixed sourcing, for states that do both origin and destination calculation

tax.description: The amount of tax generated for this line item.

taxableAmount.description: The taxable amount of this line item.

taxCalculated.description: The tax calculated for this line by Avalara.  If the transaction was calculated with a tax override, this amount will be different from the "tax" value.

taxCode.description: The code string for the tax code that was used to calculate this line item.

taxCodeId.description: The unique ID number for the tax code that was used to calculate this line item.

taxDate.description:
The date that was used for calculating tax amounts for this line item.  By default, this date should be the same as the document date.
In some cases, for example when a consumer returns a product purchased previously, line items may be calculated using a tax date in the past
so that the consumer can receive a refund for the correct tax amount that was charged when the item was originally purchased.

taxEngine.description: The tax engine identifier that was used to calculate this line item.

taxOverrideType.description: If a tax override was specified, this indicates the type of tax override.

x-enum-value-comments.TaxAmount: Tax was overriden by the client
x-enum-value-comments.Exemption: Entity exemption was ignored (e.g. item was consumed)
x-enum-value-comments.TaxDate: Only the tax date was overriden
x-enum-value-comments.DeriveTaxable: Derive the taxable amount from the tax amount

businessIdentificationNo.description: VAT business identification number used for this transaction.

taxOverrideAmount.description: If a tax override was specified, this indicates the amount of tax that was requested.

taxOverrideReason.description: If a tax override was specified, represents the reason for the tax override.

taxIncluded.description: True if tax was included in the purchase price of the item.

details.description: Optional: A list of tax details for this line item.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=Details" to your URL.

lineLocationTypes.description: Optional: A list of location types for this line item.  To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=LineLocationTypes" to your URL.

parameters.description: Contains a list of extra parameters that were set when the transaction was created.

TransactionAddressModel.description: An address used within this transaction.

id.description: The unique ID number of this address.

transactionId.description: The unique ID number of the document to which this address belongs.

boundaryLevel.description: The boundary level at which this address was validated.
boundaryLevel.x-enum-description:
Jurisdiction boundary precision level found for address.  This depends on the accuracy of the address
                as well as the precision level of the state provided jurisdiction boundaries.

line1.description: The first line of the address.

line2.description: The second line of the address.

line3.description: The third line of the address.

region.description: The region, state, or province for the address.

postalCode.description: The postal code or zip code for the address.

country.description: The country for the address.

taxRegionId.description: The unique ID number of the tax region for this address.

documentLocationTypeId.description: Location type ID for this location type in transaction

TransactionSummary.description: Summary information about an overall transaction.

country.description: Two character ISO-3166 country code.

region.description: Two or three character ISO region, state or province code, if applicable.

jurisType.description: The type of jurisdiction that collects this tax.

jurisCode.description: Jurisdiction Code for the taxing jurisdiction

jurisName.description: The name of the jurisdiction that collects this tax.

taxAuthorityType.description: The unique ID of the Tax Authority Type that collects this tax.

stateAssignedNo.description: The state assigned number of the jurisdiction that collects this tax.

taxType.description: The tax type of this tax.

x-enum-value-comments.Fee: Fee - PIFs (Public Improvement Fees) and RSFs (Retail Sales Fees)

taxGroup.description: Group code when special grouping is enabled.

rateType.description: (DEPRECATED) Indicates the tax rate type.  Please use rateTypeCode instead.

rateTypeCode.description: Indicates the code of the rate type.  Use `/api/v2/definitions/ratetypes` for a full list of rate type codes.

taxable.description: Tax Base - The adjusted taxable amount.

rate.description: Tax Rate - The rate of taxation, as a fraction of the amount.

tax.description: Tax amount - The calculated tax (Base * Rate).

taxCalculated.description: Tax Calculated by Avalara AvaTax.  This may be overriden by a TaxOverride.TaxAmount.

nonTaxable.description: The amount of the transaction that was non-taxable.

exemption.description: The amount of the transaction that was exempt.

TransactionLineDetailModel.description: An individual tax detail element.  Represents the amount of tax calculated for a particular jurisdiction, for a particular line in an invoice.

id.description: The unique ID number of this tax detail.

transactionLineId.description: The unique ID number of the line within this transaction.

transactionId.description: The unique ID number of this transaction.

addressId.description: The unique ID number of the address used for this tax detail.

country.description: The two character ISO 3166 country code of the country where this tax detail is assigned.

region.description: The two-or-three character ISO region code for the region where this tax detail is assigned.

countyFIPS.description: For U.S. transactions, the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code for the county where this tax detail is assigned.

stateFIPS.description: For U.S. transactions, the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code for the state where this tax detail is assigned.

exemptAmount.description: The amount of this line that was considered exempt in this tax detail.

exemptReasonId.description: The unique ID number of the exemption reason for this tax detail.

inState.description: True if this detail element represented an in-state transaction.

jurisCode.description: The code of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

jurisName.description: The name of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

jurisdictionId.description: The unique ID number of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

signatureCode.description: The Avalara-specified signature code of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

stateAssignedNo.description: The state assigned number of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

jurisType.description: The type of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.
jurisType.x-enum-description: Types of jurisdiction referenced in a transaction

nonTaxableAmount.description: The amount of this line item that was considered nontaxable in this tax detail.

nonTaxableRuleId.description: The rule according to which portion of this detail was considered nontaxable.

nonTaxableType.description: The type of nontaxability that was applied to this tax detail.

rate.description: The rate at which this tax detail was calculated.

rateRuleId.description: The unique ID number of the rule according to which this tax detail was calculated.

rateSourceId.description: The unique ID number of the source of the rate according to which this tax detail was calculated.

serCode.description: For Streamlined Sales Tax customers, the SST Electronic Return code under which this tax detail should be applied.

sourcing.description: Indicates whether this tax detail applies to the origin or destination of the transaction.

x-enum-value-comments.Mixed: Mixed sourcing, for states that do both origin and destination calculation

tax.description: The amount of tax for this tax detail.

taxableAmount.description: The taxable amount of this tax detail.

taxType.description: The type of tax that was calculated.  Depends on the company's nexus settings as well as the jurisdiction's tax laws.

x-enum-value-comments.Fee: Fee - PIFs (Public Improvement Fees) and RSFs (Retail Sales Fees)

taxName.description: The name of the tax against which this tax amount was calculated.

taxAuthorityTypeId.description: The type of the tax authority to which this tax will be remitted.

taxRegionId.description: The unique ID number of the tax region.

taxCalculated.description:
The amount of tax that was calculated.  This amount may be different if a tax override was used.
If the customer specified a tax override, this calculated tax value represents the amount of tax that would
have been charged if Avalara had calculated the tax for the rule.

taxOverride.description: The amount of tax override that was specified for this tax line.

rateType.description: (DEPRECATED) The rate type for this tax detail.  Please use rateTypeCode instead.

rateTypeCode.description: Indicates the code of the rate type that was used to calculate this tax detail.  Use `/api/v2/definitions/ratetypes` for a full list of rate type codes.

taxableUnits.description: Number of units in this line item that were calculated to be taxable according to this rate detail.

nonTaxableUnits.description: Number of units in this line item that were calculated to be nontaxable according to this rate detail.

exemptUnits.description: Number of units in this line item that were calculated to be exempt according to this rate detail.

unitOfBasis.description: When calculating units, what basis of measurement did we use for calculating the units?

TransactionLineLocationTypeModel.description: Represents information about location types stored in a line

documentLineLocationTypeId.description: The unique ID number of this line location address model

documentLineId.description: The unique ID number of the document line associated with this line location address model

documentAddressId.description: The address ID corresponding to this model

locationTypeCode.description: The location type code corresponding to this model

AdjustTransactionModel.description: A request to adjust tax for a previously existing transaction

adjustmentReason.description: A reason code indicating why this adjustment was made
adjustmentReason.x-enum-description: Indicates the type of adjustment that was performed on a transaction

x-enum-value-comments.NotAdjusted: The transaction has not been adjusted
x-enum-value-comments.SourcingIssue: A sourcing issue existed which caused the transaction to be adjusted
x-enum-value-comments.ReconciledWithGeneralLedger: Transaction was adjusted to reconcile it with a general ledger
x-enum-value-comments.ExemptCertApplied: Transaction was adjusted after an exemption certificate was applied
x-enum-value-comments.PriceAdjusted: Transaction was adjusted when the price of an item changed
x-enum-value-comments.ProductReturned: Transaction was adjusted due to a product return
x-enum-value-comments.ProductExchanged: Transaction was adjusted due to a product exchange
x-enum-value-comments.BadDebt: Transaction was adjusted due to bad or uncollectable debt
x-enum-value-comments.Other: Transaction was adjusted for another reason not specified

adjustmentDescription.description: If the AdjustmentReason is "Other", specify the reason here

newTransaction.description: Replace the current transaction with tax data calculated for this new transaction

type.description: Document Type: if not specified, a document with type of SalesOrder will be created by default

x-enum-value-comments.SalesOrder: Sales Order, estimate or quote (default).  This is a temporary document type and is not saved in tax history.
x-enum-value-comments.PurchaseOrder: Purchase order, estimate, or quote.  This is a temporary document type and is not saved in tax history.
x-enum-value-comments.ReturnOrder: Sales Return Order.  This is a temporary document type and is not saved in tax history.

code.description:
Transaction Code - the internal reference code used by the client application.  This is used for operations such as
Get, Adjust, Settle, and Void.  If you leave the transaction code blank, a GUID will be assigned to each transaction.

companyCode.description:
Company Code - Specify the code of the company creating this transaction here.  If you leave this value null,
your account's default company will be used instead.

date.description: Transaction Date - The date on the invoice, purchase order, etc.

salespersonCode.description: Salesperson Code - The client application salesperson reference code.

customerCode.description: Customer Code - The client application customer reference code.

customerUsageType.description:
Customer Usage Type - The client application customer or usage type.  For a list of 
available usage types, see `/api/v2/definitions/entityusecodes`.

discount.description:
Discount - The discount amount to apply to the document.  This value will be applied only to lines
that have the `discounted` flag set to true.  If no lines have `discounted` set to true, this discount
cannot be applied.

purchaseOrderNo.description:
Purchase Order Number for this document
This is required for single use exemption certificates to match the order and invoice with the certificate.

addresses.description: Default addresses for all lines in this document

parameters.description:
Special parameters for this transaction.
To get a full list of available parameters, please use the /api/v2/definitions/parameters endpoint.

referenceCode.description: Reference Code used to reference the original document for a return invoice

reportingLocationCode.description: Sets the sale location code (Outlet ID) for reporting this document to the tax authority.

commit.description:
Causes the document to be committed if true.  This option is only applicable for invoice document 
types, not orders.

taxOverride.description: Specifies a tax override for the entire document

serviceMode.description:
Specifies whether the tax calculation is handled Local, Remote, or Automatic (default).  This only 
applies when using an AvaLocal server.
serviceMode.x-enum-description: Service modes for tax calculation when using an AvaLocal server.

exchangeRate.description: Currency exchange rate from this transaction to the company base currency.

exchangeRateEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the exchange rate.

posLaneCode.description: Sets the POS Lane Code sent by the User for this document.

businessIdentificationNo.description:
VAT business identification number for the customer for this transaction.  This number will be used for all lines 
in the transaction, except for those lines where you have defined a different business identification number.

If you specify a VAT business identification number for the customer in this transaction and you have also set up
a business identification number for your company during company setup, this transaction will be treated as a 
business-to-business transaction for VAT purposes and it will be calculated according to VAT tax rules.

isSellerImporterOfRecord.description: Specifies if the Transaction has the seller as IsSellerImporterOfRecord

description.description: Description

debugLevel.description: If the user wishes to request additional debug information from this transaction, specify a level higher than 'normal'
debugLevel.x-enum-description: Indicates the level of detail requested from a tax API call

x-enum-value-comments.Normal: User requests the normal level of debug information when creating a tax transaction
x-enum-value-comments.Diagnostic: User requests additional diagnostic information when creating a tax transaction

AddressesModel.description: A series of addresses information in a GetTax call

singleLocation.description: If this transaction occurred at a retail point-of-sale location, use this

shipFrom.description: If this transaction was shipped from a warehouse location to a customer location, specify both "ShipFrom" and "ShipTo".

shipTo.description: If this transaction was shipped from a warehouse location to a customer location, specify both "ShipFrom" and "ShipTo".

pointOfOrderOrigin.description: The place of business where you receive the customer's order.

pointOfOrderAcceptance.description:
The place of business where you accept/approve the customers order,
thereby becoming contractually obligated to make the sale.

LineItemModel.description: Represents one line item in a transaction

quantity.description: Quantity of items in this line

addresses.description: Specify any differences for addresses between this line and the rest of the document

taxCode.description: Tax Code - System or Custom Tax Code.

customerUsageType.description: Customer Usage Type - The client application customer or usage type.

discounted.description: True if the document discount should be applied to this line

taxIncluded.description: Indicates if line has Tax Included; defaults to false

description.description: Item description.  This is required for SST transactions if an unmapped ItemCode is used.

businessIdentificationNo.description:
VAT business identification number for the customer for this line item.  If you leave this field empty,
this line item will use whatever business identification number you provided at the transaction level.

If you specify a VAT business identification number for the customer in this transaction and you have also set up
a business identification number for your company during company setup, this transaction will be treated as a 
business-to-business transaction for VAT purposes and it will be calculated according to VAT tax rules.

taxOverride.description: Specifies a tax override for this line

parameters.description:
Special parameters that apply to this line within this transaction.
To get a full list of available parameters, please use the /api/v2/definitions/parameters endpoint.

TaxOverrideModel.description: Represents a tax override for a transaction

type.description: Identifies the type of tax override

x-enum-value-comments.TaxAmount: Tax was overriden by the client
x-enum-value-comments.Exemption: Entity exemption was ignored (e.g. item was consumed)
x-enum-value-comments.TaxDate: Only the tax date was overriden
x-enum-value-comments.DeriveTaxable: Derive the taxable amount from the tax amount

taxAmount.description:
Indicates a total override of the calculated tax on the document.  AvaTax will distribute
the override across all the lines.

taxDate.description: The override tax date to use

reason.description: This provides the reason for a tax override for audit purposes.  It is required for types 2-4.

locationCode.description:
If you wish to use the address of an existing location for this company, specify the address here.
Otherwise, leave this value empty.

region.description: State / Province / Region

country.description: Two character ISO 3166 Country Code

VoidTransactionModel.description: A request to void a previously created transaction

code.description: Please specify the reason for voiding or cancelling this transaction
code.x-enum-description: Reason code for voiding or cancelling a transaction

x-enum-value-comments.PostFailed: Post operation failed - Document status will be changed to unposted
x-enum-value-comments.DocDeleted:
Document deleted - If committed, document status will be changed to Cancelled.  If not committed, document will be
                deleted.
x-enum-value-comments.DocVoided: Document has been voided and DocStatus will be set to Cancelled
x-enum-value-comments.AdjustmentCancelled: AdjustTax operation has been cancelled.  Adjustment will be reversed.

SettleTransactionModel.description:
Settle this transaction with your ledger by executing one or many actions against that transaction.  
You may use this endpoint to verify the transaction, change the transaction's code, and commit the transaction for reporting purposes.
This endpoint may be used to execute any or all of these actions at once.

verify.description: To use the "Settle" endpoint to verify a transaction, fill out this value.

changeCode.description: To use the "Settle" endpoint to change a transaction's code, fill out this value.

commit.description:
To use the "Settle" endpoint to commit a transaction for reporting purposes, fill out this value.
If you use Avalara Returns, committing a transaction will cause that transaction to be filed.

VerifyTransactionModel.description: Verify this transaction by matching it to values in your accounting system.

verifyTransactionDate.description: Transaction Date - The date on the invoice, purchase order, etc.

verifyTotalAmount.description: Total Amount - The total amount (not including tax) for the document.

verifyTotalTax.description: Total Tax - The total tax for the document.

ChangeTransactionCodeModel.description:
Settle this transaction with your ledger by verifying its amounts.
If the transaction is not yet committed, you may specify the "commit" value to commit it to the ledger and allow it to be reported.
You may also optionally change the transaction's code by specifying the "newTransactionCode" value.

newCode.description: To change the transaction code for this transaction, specify the new transaction code here.

commit.description:
Set this value to be true to commit this transaction.
Committing a transaction allows it to be reported on a tax return.  Uncommitted transactions will not be reported.

isLocked.description:
Set this value to be true to commit this transaction.
Committing a transaction allows it to be reported on a tax return.  Uncommitted transactions will not be reported.
The lock status to set for the documents designated in this API

BulkLockTransactionResult.description: Returns information about transactions that were locked

numberOfRecords.description: Number of records that have been modified

createTransactionModel.description: The create transaction model to be created or updated.

AuditTransactionModel.description: Information about a previously created transaction

companyId.description: Unique ID number of the company that created this transaction

serverTimestamp.description: Server timestamp, in UTC, of the date/time when the original transaction was created

serverDuration.description: Length of time the original API call took

apiCallStatus.x-enum-description: Indicates what level of auditing information is available for a transaction

x-enum-value-comments.OriginalApiCallAvailable: If the original api call is availabe on S3
x-enum-value-comments.ReconstructedApiCallAvailable: if the original api call is not available, reconstructed api call should always be available

OriginalApiRequestResponseModel.description: Represents the exact API request and response from the original transaction API call, if available

ReconstructedApiRequestResponseModel.description:
This model contains a reconstructed CreateTransaction request object that could potentially be used
to recreate this transaction.

Note that the API changes over time, and this reconstructed model is likely different from the exact request
that was originally used to create this transaction.

refundTransactionCode.description: the committed transaction code to be refunded

refundDate.description: The date of the refund. If null, today's date will be used

x-enum-value-comments.Partial: Refund only specific lines from the original a transaction.
x-enum-value-comments.TaxOnly: Only refund the tax part of the transaction.
x-enum-value-comments.Percentage: Refund a percentage of the value of this transaction.
